TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed DataGridViewSelectionMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Describes how cells of a DataGridView control can be selected.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This enumeration is used to set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SelectionMode%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control.
## Examples The following code example illustrates the use of this type. For more information, see [How to: Set the Selection Mode of the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewMisc#065](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.d_139_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewMisc#065](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.d_139_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectionMode CellSelect = int32(0)

Docs.summary: One or more individual cells can be selected.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectionMode ColumnHeaderSelect = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The column will be selected by clicking in the column's header cell. An individual cell can be selected by clicking that cell.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectionMode FullColumnSelect = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The entire column will be selected by clicking the column's header or a cell contained in that column.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectionMode FullRowSelect = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The entire row will be selected by clicking its row's header or a cell contained in that row.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectionMode RowHeaderSelect = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The row will be selected by clicking in the row's header cell. An individual cell can be selected by clicking that cell.
